case_vignette: A 14-year-old previously healthy male presents to your office with complaints of two months of dull, aching pain in his right leg that has recently become worse. While he experiences the pain constantly, he notes that it is sometimes so bad at night that it awakes him from his sleep. Though an avid soccer player, he has been unable to participate this season due to the pain and difficulty running. He cannot think of any particular trauma that might have precipitated this pain. Vitals are all within normal range. Physical examination reveals localized tenderness below the knee with mild swelling and reduced range of motion. You order an X-ray of the painful limb, which is shown in Figure A.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Hematology and Oncology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having a dull, aching pain in my right leg for two months, and it's gotten so bad recently that it sometimes wakes me up at night.
Have you noticed any swelling or redness in the affected area?
Yes, there's some mild swelling and it's tender below my knee.
Have you had any recent injuries or trauma to your leg?
No, I can't think of any particular injury that might have caused this pain.
Have you had any medical conditions or surgeries in the past that might be related to this pain?
I've been healthy and haven't had any medical conditions or surgeries.
Have you noticed any changes in your appetite or weight?
No, there haven't been any changes in my appetite or weight.
Have you noticed any changes in your energy levels or overall well-being?
No, my energy levels and overall well-being have remained the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin or mucous membranes?
No, there haven't been any changes in my skin or mucous membranes.
Have you noticed any changes in your urine or stool?
No, I haven't noticed any changes in my urine or stool.
Have you noticed any changes in your breathing or coughing?
No, my breathing is normal and I'm not coughing.
Have you noticed any changes in your vision or hearing?
No, my vision and hearing are fine; there haven't been any changes.
Have you noticed any changes in your mood or mental health?
No, my mood and mental health have stayed the same.
Have you noticed any changes in your family history of medical conditions?
No, there haven't been any changes in my family's medical history.
Final Diagnosis: Deep Vein Thrombosis (DVT)
